abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande announces withdrawal of his proposal to take away citizenship from dual nationals who are convicted of terrorism; while proposal was largely symbolic, opposition it drew from left in country illustrated growing divide in Hollande's Socialist Party over best way to handle terrorism in wake of Paris terrorist attacks.

headline.print_headline: French President Drops Proposal to Revoke Citizenship in Terrorism Cases
headline.main: François Hollande Cancels Plan to Strip French Citizenship in Terrorism Cases

snippet: The idea to punish dual nationals had drawn furious opposition from the left in France, even though all sides agreed it was largely symbolic.
lead_paragraph: The idea to punish dual nationals had drawn furious opposition from the left in France, even though all sides agreed it was largely symbolic.
